page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN TERLING
page.content: Whereas in the old days, almost all the villagers would have been employed on Lord Rayleigh's estate, nowadays only about a third are employed there, either on the farms, in the Estate yard, in Lord Rayleigh's Dairies or in the vehicle maintenance depot. The farm is administered by the Office at Whitelands, which employs several secretarial and administrative staff. The Management, most of whom are members of the Strutt family, have offices here. Since Terling is a highly desirable village, in which to live, and within easy commuting distance of London, with Hatfield Peveral Station only 3 miles away, several new families have come here to live and commute. Many people work in Chelmsford _ several for Marconi.Some work in Witham, which is about 5 miles away,also in Colchester.
